alert.note: Alert for Banner; Kimball (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 4:47PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong snow squall with thunder will impact portions of northwestern Kimball, southwestern Banner, southeastern Goshen and northeastern Laramie Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 346 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong snow squall 8 miles west of Hawk Springs, or 22 miles southwest of Torrington, moving south at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, soft hail, and reduced visibility. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... La Grange, Albin, Hawk Springs Campground, Hawk Springs Recreation Area, Meriden Rest Area, Gun Barrel and Hawk Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
